intro: Mezzettia umbellata var. abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stalked mezzettia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound umbels and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and small, finely divided leaves. Its flowers are white to pale green, arranged in compact umbels, and bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
